citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A brown domestic lamb was found to have a mild limp with toe touching on the rear left leg but the attending veterinarian
had not been notified of its condition. The facility representatives state they noticed the lamb start limping yesterday
afternoon and it may have been kicked by another animal in the enclosure. Limping could indicate an underlying health
issue and if left untreated could result in the pain or physical distress.
The licensee must have frequent and direct communication with the attending veterinarian so that timely and accurate
information on problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being can be evaluated by the attending veterinarian. This
animal must be evaluated by a licensed veterinarian for an accurate diagnosis and to develop an effective treatment plan.
A veterinary appointment was made during the inspection for later the same day.
This inspection was a site approval inspection.
This site is not ready for approval to conduct activity covered under your current Animal Welfare Act License.
Conducting regulated activities at a non-approved site is a violation of the Animal Welfare Act.
Please contact your inspector to schedule your next new site approval inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Director and other facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A brown domestic lamb was found to have a mild limp with toe touching on the rear left leg but the attending veterinarian 
had not been notified of its condition. The facility representatives state they noticed the lamb start limping yesterday 
afternoon and it may have been kicked by another animal in the enclosure. Limping could indicate an underlying health 
issue and if left untreated could result in the pain or physical distress.  
The licensee must have frequent and direct communication with the attending veterinarian so that timely and accurate 
information on problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being can be evaluated by the attending veterinarian. This 
animal must be evaluated by a licensed veterinarian for an accurate diagnosis and to develop an effective treatment plan. 
A veterinary appointment was made during the inspection for later the same day. 
 
This inspection was a site approval inspection. 
 
This site is not ready for approval to conduct activity covered under your current Animal Welfare Act License. 
 
Conducting regulated activities at a non-approved site is a violation of the Animal Welfare Act. 
 
Please contact your inspector to schedule your next new site approval inspection. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Director and other facility representatives.
